DataElement.preferredDefinition: The yes/no/not applicable coded response regarding whether a patient is taking any medication that is not part of protocol treatment (including medication prescribed for other medical conditions).

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the use of concomitant medication.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Concomitant; following as a consequence.:biologically active substance, including those intended for use in diagnosis, treatment, or prevention of disease or other abnormalities, for the relief of suffering, or control or improvement of a physical or mental state; includes biological products.

Concepts.definition: Accessory, accompanying especially in a subordinate or incidental way, occurring or existing during the same period of time.

A drug product that contains one or more active and/or inactive ingredients; it is intended to treat, prevent or alleviate the symptoms of disease. This term does not refer to the individual ingredients that make up the product.

Property.preferredDefinition: Use; put into service; make work or employ (something) for a particular purpose or for its inherent or natural purpose.

Concepts.definition: A manner, or usual, or accepted practice of using something.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable._The affirmative response to a question or activity._The non-affirmative response to a question._Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the patient receiving any of the following concomitant medications during navitoclax administration: Warfarin, clopidogrel (Plavix), ibuprofen, tirofiban (Aggrastat), and other anticoagulants, drugs, or herbal supplements that affect platelet function?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Is patient receiving a prohib
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient receiving a prohibited medication concurrently?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient require the use of a prohibited medication as defined in protocol?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient require the concurrent use of prohibited medications as noted in section 3.2.15 and appendix F of the protocol?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient require the concomitant use of CYP3A4/5 substrates with a narrow therapeutic index, potent CYP2D6 inhibitor/inducer, P-gp inhibitor, BCRP inhibitor, or potent CYP2C9 inhibitor/inducers while on study treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient taking concurrent treatment with any medication or substance that are substrates of CYP2C9 without consulting investigator?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient using any medications considered to be inhibitors or substrates of UGT1A1, or inhibitors or inducers of P-gp?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient receiving concurrent treatment with a non-permitted concomitant medication?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the patient using any sensitive substrates of CYP3A4, CYP2C9 and/or CYP2D6 with a narrow therapeutic window within 1 week prior to the anticipated start date of study treatment?
